title: ASX to rise, oil prices further collapse
summary: Australian shares are set to open higher, bolstered by overnight gains in Europe and on Wall Street. However, oil and gold both fell.
author: Timothy Moore

title: ASX set to drop as virus cases multiply
summary: Australian shares are expected to fall lower to start the week as the number of people with the COVID-19 virus continues to rise as does the economic cost.
author: Timothy Moore

title: ASX to open higher, Wall St extends rally
summary: The Dow recouped another 4pc from its recent rout as investors bet massive stimulus would help limit the coronavirus' economic damage.
author: Timothy Moore

title: Global equities rally on US rescue package
summary: Australian shares are set to extend their relief rally as investors positioned for approval of a multi-trillion US coronavirus rescue package.
author: Timothy Moore

title: Dow surges more than 2100 points
summary: Shares leaped higher in New York amid signs that a more than $3 trillion rescue package was closer to approval in Washington.
author: Timothy Moore

title: Wall St lower, ASX futures point to higher open
summary: Australian shares appear set to open higher. Wall Street continues to search for a floor. $A steady.
author: Timothy Moore

title: ASX to extend losses as global economy shuts down
summary: Australian shares are poised to open lower as efforts to contain the coronavirus bring the global economy to a sudden stop.
author: Timothy Moore

title: ASX to rise, tech shares boost Wall Street
summary: Australian shares are pointing toward a higher open. $A recovers, then slides. Nasdaq leads in New York.
author: Timothy Moore

title: Dow sheds 6.3pc, NYSE to close trading floor
summary: A fourth 15-minute trading halt tempered, somewhat, the sell-off on Wall Street. ASX futures drop. $A flirts with US56Â¢ handle.
author: Timothy Moore

title: US stocks surge into the close
summary: All three major US benchmarks closed sharply higher as momentum surged toward the closing bell.
author: Timothy Moore

title: ASX to extend slide, Wall St plunges
summary: At 4pm in New York, the Dow was 2999 points or 12.9% lower. ASX futures fell 202 points or 4%.
author: Timothy Moore

title: ASX to rise, G7 leaders approach pitch
summary: Australian shares are poised to open higher after Wall Street leapt higher on bets the US was finally taking the coronavirus seriously.
author: Timothy Moore

title: Markets collapse as Trump misses mark
summary: Global equities were pummelled overnight after President Donald Trump fuelled panic selling. The Fed sought, to little avail, to bolster confidence.
author: Timothy Moore

title: Dow closes in bear market, ASX to plunge
summary: Fears about the coronavirus once again hammered Wall Street, ending its 11-year bull market, and has set the ASX for a sharp opening drop.
author: Timothy Moore

title: Dow Jones swings higher, ASX to rise
summary: The Dow ended up more than 1100 points or 4.9pc after a wild session of violent swings. The S&P/ASX is poised to rise 1pc at its open.
author: Timothy Moore

title: Market losses accelerate as does uncertainty
summary: Shares in Europe and in the US collapsed, as panic selling drove a continued repricing of risk assets.
author: Timothy Moore

title: ASX to plunge anew, stimulus awaited
summary: Australian shares are poised to open lower as the coronavirus continues to spread outside China, with a particular focus on the US.
author: Timothy Moore

title: Global equities sell-off amid renewed virus fears
summary: Bearish sentiment knocked more than 1000 points from the Dow by late trade in New York amid ever heightening worries about the coronavirus.
author: Timothy Moore

title: ASX to rise, US rates seen as low as 0pc
summary: Australian shares are set to leap 1.8pc, as investors bet that the US central bank is far from done in cutting rates. The Dow surged 4.5pc.
author: Timothy Moore

title: ASX to open lower as volatility persists
summary: Australian shares are poised to open lower as investors question if lower global interest rates will be enough to restore stability.
author: Timothy Moore

title: Dow surges near 1300 points on rate cut bets
summary: Australian shares are poised to open higher, bolstered by a stunning late day rally in New York that lifted the Dow more than 5 per cent.
author: Timothy Moore

title: ASX to extend losses to start week
summary: Australian shares are poised to open lower, as investors continue to step away from equities amid continuing uncertainty about the coronavirus outbreak.
author: Timothy Moore
